alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chuska Mountains; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Espanola Valley; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Far Northwest Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northeast Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Quay County; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Union County; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 2:55PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, AND UPPER RIO GRANDE VALLEY FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... Snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches between 5,000 to 7,500 feet with 4 to 12 inches above 7,500 feet are possible across central and northern New Mexico Friday morning through Saturday afternoon. The heaviest snowfall is expected Friday night through early Saturday. Snowfall may create slick roads, including I-25 from Santa Fe to the Colorado border, I-40 from Tijeras Canyon to the Texas border, Highway 64 in northern NM, and Highway 84 from the Colorado border to Santa Fe. Snowpacked roadways and areas of blowing snow that reduce visibility are possible above 8,000 feet in northern NM. Holiday travelers should stay tuned to forecast updates as this storm system approaches. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick spots on roadways. Allow for extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
